intro: Gossypianthus lanuginosus var. sheldonii, commonly known as Sheldon's woolly cotton, is a member of the Malvaceae family, characterized by its soft, hairy foliage and showy flowers. It is native to South Africa and thrives in coastal regions with a Mediterranean climate. The plant features simple, alternate leaves covered in fine, white hairs, giving it a woolly appearance. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and numerous stamens, adding to its ornamental value. It is often cultivated as a decorative plant for its unique appearance and adaptability to well-drained soils.
